subject: RE: [junit] Stress Test: Running n copies of test simultaneously
msgSnippet: Vishal, try JUnitPerf, download from www.clarkware.com I am writing a GUI to run stress tests and timed tests using JUnitPerf Shailesh ... From: vxmehra98
messageBody:
Vishal,

try JUnitPerf, download from www.clarkware.com I am writing a GUI to run
stress tests and timed tests using JUnitPerf

Shailesh
-----Original Message-----
From: vxmehra98 [mailto:vishalm@...]
Sent: Monday, May 13, 2002 11:16 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Stress Test: Running n copies of test simultaneously


Is there is an easy way to run multiple instances of the same test
(or group of tests) simultaneously both in thread mode as well as
process mode.

I understand that I can add n copies of the same test using TestSuite

suite.addTestSuite( MyFirstTestCase.class );
suite.addTestSuite( MyFirstTestCase.class );

and so on.

But in this case, test will run sequentially instead of running
simultaneously as required for stress test.

Any suggestions..


-Vishal
